articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Dec. 17, the greatest national mourning day.
					 He entered the hall where the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il stand.
					
					 Seen standing before the statues was a floral basket sent by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He paid high homage to the statues.
					
					 He made a deep bow to Kim Jong Il in the hall of immortality where he lies in state.
					
					 He made a solemn pledge to fight more unflinchingly as befits a revolutionary soldier of Kim Jong Il in order to steadily develop the Workers' Party of Korea into the dignified Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist party and to consolidate the country into the strong one, where Kim Jong Il's desires come true, and the fortress independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in defence.

articles.title: Greetings to Emir of Qatar
articles.content:
Greetings to Emir of Qatar
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, Presidium member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Tamim Bin Hamad Al-Thani, emir of Qatar, on the occasion of its independence day.
					 Kim in the message wished the emir good health and happiness and bigger success in the work for the country's development and prosperity, expressing the belief that the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would further develop in the future, too.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Mongolia Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Mongolia Appointed
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- O Sung Ho was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Mongolia, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Visits Korean Revolution Museum
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Visits Korean Revolution Museum
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Japanese Women's Society for the Study of the Juche Idea to learn from Kim Jong Suk led by Yoko Hayashi, member of the Shizuoka Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, visited the Korean Revolution Museum.
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary career of the anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk, the visitors went round relics and data on display.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Phyongchon Revolutionary Site, the Revolutionary Museum of the Ministry of Railways and other places.

articles.title: Meeting to Congratulate DPRK Women Footballers Held in Japan
articles.content:
Meeting to Congratulate DPRK Women Footballers Held in Japan
Tokyo, December 17 (KNS-KCNA) -- A meeting of officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and Koreans in Japan was held in Tokyo, Japan on Dec. 16 to congratulate the DPRK women footballers who proved successful in the 2017 EAFF E-1 Football Championship.
					 Present there were Chairman Ho Jong Man, vice-chairmen Nam Sung U and Pae Ik Ju of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, its Vice-Chairwoman Kang Chu Ryon who is chairwoman of the Central Standing Committee of the Union of Democratic Korean Women in Japan, chairpersons of the Chongryon headquarters in Kanto area, leading officials of central organizations and business groups and Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Ho Jong Man said in his speech that the DPRK women footballers won the title of the championship by defeating the Chinese, south Korean and Japanese teams and thus displayed the dignity and might of Juche Korea.
					
					 Their success instilled into the officials of Chongryon and all other compatriots in Japan the honor and pride of being overseas citizens of the DPRK, he added.
					
					 Kim Jang San, secretary general of the DPRK Football Association, in his speech expressed deep thanks to officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan for their heartfelt support and cheering.
					
					 He said that the DPRK women footballers would prove successful at international games in the future, too, and give greater strength and courage to the Koreans in Japan firmly defending the soul of the Korean nation.

articles.title: DPRK Sportspersons Prove Successful at 2017 Int'l Games
articles.content:
DPRK Sportspersons Prove Successful at 2017 Int'l Games
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- DPRK athletes have won a number of gold medals at international games in Juche 106 (2017) to add luster to the history of building a sports power.
					 Om Yun Chol, Rim Jong Sim, Kim Kuk Hyang, Ri Hyon Ju and other players bagged 12 gold medals at the 29th Summer Universiad, while Taekwon-Do players seized 22 gold medals out of 36 at the 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships.
					
					 Women footballers took the first place at the 2017 AFC U-16 Women's Championship for the third time after 2007 and 2015 and had three consecutive wins at the EAFF E-1 Football Championship this year.
					
					 Kim Hye Gyong breasted the tape at the 16th Asian Marathon Championships with 2:28:35, 3 minutes and 11 seconds faster than her record at the 15th Asian Marathon Championships, to emerge as the twice Asian champion.
					
					 Han Jong Sim, Kim Il Gyong and Ri Kwang Song took gold medals at the World Juvenile Weightlifting Championships held in April, Rim Un Sim and Sin Chol Bom at the Asian Weightlifting Championships in April and Song Kuk Hyang, Kang Hyon Gyong and Pak Jong Ju at the Asian Junior and Juvenile Weightlifting Championships in July.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK athletes also proved successful at the 64th World Military Pentathlon, 10th Asian Acrobatic Gymnastic Championship, 7th Gymnastics Asian Championships, 2017 Grand Prix Diving Game sponsored by the International Federation of Swimming, 1st East-Asian Judo Championships of the International Military Sports Council and other games.

articles.title: Symposium on History and Culture of Koguryo Held
articles.content:
Symposium on History and Culture of Koguryo Held
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- A symposium on the history and culture of Koguryo took place at the Sci-Tech Complex on Monday.
					 Present there were officials concerned, researchers, teachers, writers, journalists and editors in the fields of science, education, literature and arts, media and the protection of national heritage.
					
					 The speakers stressed it was an event of weighty significance in the development of Korea's history in the age of Three Kingdoms that Koguryo moved its capital to Pyongyang in 427, adding:
					
					 Koguryo set Pyongyang as its capital as Pyongyang is the birthplace of King Tangun, ancestral father of the nation, and it was associated with the soul of the Korean nation as the birthplace of Ancient Korea, and its position was geographically favorable in the struggle for unifying Three Kingdoms.
					
					 In this context, Pyongyang's position was completely secured as the sacred area of the nation and it became the center and powerful base for accomplishing the cause of unifying the kingdoms and the country's external prestige was further enhanced.
					
					 The recently unearthed mural paintings in Posong-ri, Rangnang District, Pyongyang, proved that Koguryo was a powerful country with strong military muscle in the first half of the Third Century and the condition favorable for the move of its capital to Pyongyang was created through its boosted political and military control over the area.
					
					 In view of Taesongsan Fort, the metropolitan fort of Koguryo in early 5th century, and the scale, formation, arrangement and architectural methods of Anhak Palace and defense system of the fort, Koguryo had the capital as befitting the power in the East both in name and reality.
					
					 Speakers added that the customs of Koguryo peculiar to the Korean nation which had a great impact on neighboring countries for many years are, indeed, the precious heritage of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Trump Should Cool His Head and Face up to Reality: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Trump Should Cool His Head and Face up to Reality: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- Such opinion that Trump might order a preemptive attack on the DPRK is widely spreading among former and incumbent officials of the U.S. administration, media and experts recently.
					 Those concerned of the U.S. Department of Defense think that the possibility of an armed clash on the Korean peninsula with a U.S. preemptive attack next year is 40 to 50 percent, and some former officials of the Department of State comment that the possibility of a war between the DPRK and the U.S. is more than it.
					
					 Recalling Trump's recent special meeting with some hard-liners insisting on a preemptive attack on the DPRK, U.S. media are claiming "the war chariot of the Trump administration began to move" and "it is reminiscent of the Bush administration preparing for a war against Iraq."
					
					 In view of the present situation, there is widespread concern and criticism among Americans that "if a war with north Korea breaks out, a disaster more terrible than the one during the Second World War might be brought to the U.S. mainland" and "it will cause such a disastrous result as killing of up to two million in the U.S., south Korea and Japan.
					
					 Former Rear Admiral Michael Smith and 57 other ex-generals of the U.S. army sent an official letter to Trump on Dec. 13 in opposition to his war scenario, claiming military action of the U.S. and its allies may invite immediate retaliatory shelling by north Korea which would cause hundreds of thousands of casualties. Military action will only put in peril the lives of 150 000 Americans living in south Korea and the U.S. is bound to be involved in the war which might be prevented, they added.
					
					 Charles V. Pena, former director of the Defense Policy Institute of the Cato Institute in a commentary he contributed to the international relations magazine National Interest asserted a total war with the DPRK will bring very critical consequences.
					
					 Recalling the claim made by the commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea in 1994 when Clinton considered the use of force against the DPRK's nuclear program, he noted:
					
					 The commander claimed that if a war with the DPRK breaks out, it will cause at least one million casualties and economic loss of one trillion US dollars. Even a limited attack on the DPRK's nuclear missile bases will not be accepted by it as a limited one. To think the DPRK would remain passive toward the attack is a pipedream. Such attack will only entail strong retaliation by it.
					
					 A professor of the U.S. asked Trump as to whether he, as reasonable president, can unleash a war against Pyongyang although he knows that it can launch a missile tipped with nuclear warhead before the U.S. forces' air strike reaches it.
					
					 The results of the opinion poll conducted by the Washington Post and ABC found that at least 70 percent of the respondents said no to the preemptive strike and 82 percent of them expressed serious concern that military attack would spill over into a large-scale war.
					
					 The U.S. magazine News Week reported the opinion poll results that two third of the Americans remain averse to the war with the DPRK.
					
					 The public opinion opposed to the preemptive attack is getting stronger in the U.S. It can be viewed as a sort of advice that the U.S. administration should drop the adventurous and risky way of thinking and boldly make a U-turn in its policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The right to preemptive attack is not exclusive to the U.S. The U.S. should cool-headedly face up to the reality that the iron-willed DPRK's preemptive nuclear attack against provocateurs is just not hot air.

articles.title: Final Victory Is Definite: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Final Victory Is Definite: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The revolutionary cause of Juche and the cause of national reunification are sure to be realized and the DPRK's final victory in the showdown with the U.S. is definite as it is guided by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un with courage and pluck of Mt Paektu, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Kim Jong Un has turned misfortunes into blessings and achieved ever-victory in the indomitable spirit of attack and the sprit of Mt Paektu. This is his mode of great revolutionary leadership.
					
					 The U.S. and other hostile forces are now resorting to the harshest sanctions to totally obliterate the DPRK's sovereignty and rights to existence and development. And they get hell-bent on the military provocation with huge nuclear strategic assets involved, pushing the situation to the brink of a nuclear war. But it is no more than last-ditch efforts of those on the death-bed.
					
					 Even under such ferocious sanctions and pressure moves, Juche Korea emerged a nuclear power and a rocket power in a short span of time. This heroic myth evidently proves that no force can check the progress of our army and people advancing by dint of self-reliance and self-development, rallied as one in mind around their great leader.
					
					 We have the great Party, the great people and tremendous strength. No aggression forces can pounce on the DPRK any longer. Nobody can deny the strategic position of the DPRK defending the country's sovereignty and territorial integrity and guaranteeing the regional and global peace with its actual strength.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet forces' harsh sanctions and frantic nuclear war moves will only precipitate their own final doom.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Anti-DPRK Sanctions Racket Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Anti-DPRK Sanctions Racket Slammed
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- Days ago, the south Korean puppet authorities additionally announced a "proposal for independent sanctions" against the Democratic People's Republic of Korea over its test-fire of ICBM Hwasong-15.  They blacklisted 12 citizens and 20 organizations of the DPRK, claiming that it is to ban "unlawful financial transaction" related to the "nuclear and missile development".
					 This is another unpardonable political provocation to the DPRK and a vicious challenge to the desire and demand of the nation for north-south reconciliation and unity, Rodong Sinmun says in a commentary Monday, and goes on:
					
					 The "proposal for independent sanctions" revealed once again the dirty colors of the traitors obsessed with blind obedience and dependence on outsiders.
					
					 No matter how desperately they may try to impose sanctions and pressure on the DPRK as stooges of the U.S., it will get them nowhere. Such moves will only enhance the DPRK's spirit of self-development.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, the DPRK is fully prepared to cope with any provocation by the U.S. and its vassal forces. The most miserable end awaits those resorting to the futile sanctions without any foresight.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's Junket to Neighboring Country under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's Junket to Neighboring Country under Fire
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The chief executive of south Korea visited a neighboring country from December 13 to 16. They claimed that the aim of this visit was to discuss the ways for "restoration of the relations" and "solution to the north's nuclear issue and peace".
					 Commenting on the fact, Minju Joson on Monday says:
					
					 The junket was, in fact, to escape from the international isolation worsening day by day and solicit cooperation in putting pressure on the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities eagerly begged for "restoring relations", lost to shame, and disclosed their sinister intention to intensify the pressure upon the DPRK, requesting "halt to oil supply," etc.
					
					 What is deplorable is the argument that they wanted to be accorded hospitality and respect during the tour.
					
					 They grumbled that the opposite side cold-shouldered them and lacked sincerity in the recent junket of the "president", while claiming the visit was "successful".
					
					 It is nothing but a disgraceful behavior of those who do not know where they stand.
					
					 The puppet forces are no more than colonial servants who should do at the dictates of the U.S., without their own view or principles. As a matter of fact, it is a waste of time and tiresome to meet with the puppet forces.
					
					 In a nutshell, the recent visit of the south Korean chief executive was mendicant diplomacy and low-profile one as he revealed himself that his appearance was so poor under the eyes of the world.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted on Russian Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted on Russian Website
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The full text of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding the Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" was posted on the Russian website DPRK Today on Dec. 11 to commemorate the sixth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The work, published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies that it is the principled requirement for victoriously advancing the cause of the Korean revolution to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 It indicates the tasks for steadily strengthening the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's portrait was also posted on the website.

articles.title: Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Feats Held Abroad
articles.content:
Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Feats Held Abroad
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- Seminars on the feats of leader Kim Jong Il took place in Kyrgyzstan, Serbia, Bulgaria, Benin, Sri Lanka and Indonesia between Dec. 4 and 12 to commemorate the 6th anniversary of his demise.
					 The chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Kyrgyzstan who is chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party said that Kim Jong Il, eternal head of the Workers' Party of Korea, is the great leader who led the Korean revolution to victory.
					
					 The chief of the Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and other speakers stressed that Kim Jong Il is a distinguished thinker-theoretician and a great practician and his greatest feat is that he defended socialism. He dedicated his all to the people's happiness with warm love for them, they noted.
					
					 The chairman of the Sri Lanka Society for Self-Reliance Studies said that what is important of Kim Jong Il's exploits was that he pursued the Songun politics, adding that he dynamically advanced the socialist cause, holding high the Songun banner at a time when the anti-socialist offensive of the imperialist allied forces focused on the DPRK.
					
					 The manager of the Milenia Armada Ekspres Company of Indonesia and the manager of Alram Bahagia Bersama Company of Indonesia said that Kim Jong Il will always live in the hearts of the Korean people and the world's progressives, lauding his feats for the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Myanmar, Algerian Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Myanmar, Algerian Personages
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- Personages of Myanmar and Algeria issued statements between Nov. 26 and Dec. 9 to commemorate the 6th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, said:
					
					 The world progressive people's respect and yearning for HE Kim Jong Il are growing deeper with passage of time.
					
					 He reliably defended the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation from the hostile forces' vicious moves by pursuing the original Songun politics.
					
					 Maung Maung Naing, director of the Myanmar Mit Tarmor Publishing House, said that they pay the highest tribute to HE Kim Jong Il who dedicated his all to the human cause of independence, adding:
					
					 His ideology and lines became the eternal banner showing the road ahead of mankind and his feats serve as an eternal foundation guaranteeing the prosperity of the DPRK and the rosy future of its people and the global peace and security.
					
					 His august name and undying feats will be kept in the minds of the Korean people and the world's progressives forever.
					
					 Ali Garjooli, a writer and journalist of Algeria, said that the great changes taking place in the DPRK would have been unthinkable without leadership of Kim Jong Il. He devoted all his life to the country and the people, and the feats of the peerlessly great man will be handed down from generation to generation, he added.

articles.title: Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association Releases Bulletin
articles.content:
Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association Releases Bulletin
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association released a bulletin to commemorate the 6th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's demise, the 6th anniversary of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 100th birth anniversary of the anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk.
					 The bulletin said:
					
					 It was the greatest of Comrade Kim Jong Il's feats that he reliably defended socialism of Korea with the Songun politics.
					
					 He held higher the banner of Songun in the rigorous period when the imperialist allied forces went more frantic in their moves to stifle the DPRK, taking advantage of the collapse of socialism in various countries, and the country was faced with unprecedented difficulties and trials repeatedly due to consecutive natural disasters.
					
					 Thanks to his ceaseless inspection of its units, KPA was strengthened into an invincible army.
					
					 The bulletin referred to the fact that the military might of the DPRK has grown stronger day by day under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un who is invariably carrying forward the idea and cause of the great leaders.
					
					 It further said:
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Suk is the anti-Japanese war heroine who devotedly safeguarded Comrade Kim Il Sung and the great mother who provided the future of the Korean revolution.
					
					 That's why the Korean people pay high tribute to her, missing her very much still now.

articles.title: Works of DPRK's Great Men Introduced in Brazil
articles.content:
Works of DPRK's Great Men Introduced in Brazil
Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea posted works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un on its website on Dec. 6, with the sixth anniversary of Kim Jong Il's demise as an occasion.
					  They are Kim Il Sung's work "For the Establishment of a United Party of the Working Masses," Kim Jong Il's work "Abuses of Socialism Are Intolerable" and Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism".

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
Pyongyang, 18 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El 17 de diciembre, dia de maxima recordacion nacional, el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un visito el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan.
					El Maximo Dirigente entro en el hall donde se encuentran las estatuas de pie del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Ante sus estatuas de pie, estaba un cesto de flores enviado por el Maximo Dirigente.
					
					Kim Jong Un rindio homenaje al Presidente y al Dirigente ante sus estatuas de pie.
					
					El hizo lo mismo al Dirigente en el hall de eternidad donde esta conservado su cuerpo.
					
					El Maximo Dirigente tomo un juramento solemne de luchar mas tesoneramente como soldado revolucionario del Dirigente para fortalecer y desarrollar infinitamente el Partido del Trabajo de Corea como digna organizacion Kimilsungista-Kimjongilista y consolidar mas la Corea como poderosa fortaleza independiente, autarquica y autodefensiva donde se realizan los deseos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita el Dia de Independencia de Qatar
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita el Dia de Independencia de Qatar
Pyongyang, 18 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 18 un mensaje de felicitacion al emir del Estado de Qatar, Tamim Bin Hamad Al-Thani, por el Dia de Independencia de ese pais.
					Convencido de que se consolidaran y se desarrollaran en el futuro tambien los lazos de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Qatar, el remitente formulo sinceros votos por la buena salud y felicidad del destinatario y por mayores exitos en sus responsabilidades para el desarrollo y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Nombrado nuevo embajador de la RPDC en Mongolia
articles.content:
Nombrado nuevo embajador de la RPDC en Mongolia
Pyongyang, 18 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Segun el decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, O Sung Ho fue designado como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC en Mongolia.

articles.title: Deportistas coreanos conquistan muchas medallas de oro en 2017
articles.content:
Deportistas coreanos conquistan muchas medallas de oro en 2017
Pyongyang, 18 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En el ano 106 (2017) de la Era Juche, los deportistas coreanos ganaron muchas medallas de oro en las competencias internacionales.
					En la 29a Universiada Mundial de Verano, Om Yun Chol, Rim Jong Sim, Kim Kuk Hyang, Ri Hyon Ju y otros pesistas y clavadistas conquistaron 12 preseas de oro.
					
					En el XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do, la RPDC se llevo 22 de las 36 medallas de oro del evento.
					
					Las futbolistas coreanas resultaron campeonas por tercera vez en el Campeonato Sub-16 (f) de la Confederacion Asiatica de Futbol 2017 y en el Campeonato E-1 de la Federacion de las Asociaciones de Futbol del Este de Asia de 2017.
					
					En el 16o Campeonato Asiatico de Maraton, Kim Hye Gyong se hizo bicampeona asiatica con el registro de 2 horas 28 minutos 35 segundos.
					
					En el Campeonato Mundial de Jovenes de Levantamiento de Pesas y el Campeonato Asiatico de Levantamiento de Pesas, efectuados en abril, subieron a lo mas alto del podio Han Jong Sim, Kim Il Gyong y Ri Kwang Song, Rim Un Sim y Sin Chol Bom. Y en el Campeonato Asiatico de Levantamiento de Pesas de Jovenes y Juniores de julio, Song Kuk Hyang, Kang Hyon Gyong y Pak Jong Ju colocaron la bandera nacional a lo mas alto del asta.
					
					Aparecieron campeones coreanos tambien en el 64o Pentatlon Militar Mundial, el X Campeonato Asiatico de Gimnasia Acrobatica, el VII Campeonato Asiatico de Gimnasia de Aparatos, la Competencia de Clavado Grand Prix de 2017, auspiciada por la Federacion Internacional de Natacion, el Primer Campeonato de Judo de Asia Oriental del Consejo Internacional de Deportes Militares y otros eventos internacionales.

articles.title: EE.UU. debe juzgar con serenidad la realidad de hoy: comentario de ACNC
articles.content:
EE.UU. debe juzgar con serenidad la realidad de hoy: comentario de ACNC
Pyongyang, 18 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En estos dias se expande rapidamente entre los ex funcionarios y otros en servicio activo, los medios de prensa y los especialistas norteamericanos el rumor de que Trump puede asestar realmente el ataque preventivo contra el Norte de Corea.
					Los funcionarios del Pentagono estiman que oscila entre 40% y 50% la probabilidad de que ocurra en la Peninsula Coreana el choque militar en el ano que viene como producto de ataque preventivo de EE.UU. Y los ex funcionarios del Departamento de Estado evaluan que sobrepasa esa cifra la posibilidad de guerra entre Corea y EE.UU.
					
					Hace poco, los medios de prensa norteamericanos hicieron referencia al hecho de que Trump se reunio por separado con las figuras conocidas como halcones que insisten en la ofensiva sorpresiva anti-RPDC. Y agregan que "comenzo a moverse el mecanismo de guerra de la administracion Trump" y "este hecho hace imaginar a la ex administracion Bush que preparaba la guerra de Irak".
					
					Con respecto a la situacion actual, se escuchan en el interior de EE.UU. las voces de preocupacion y critica de que "si estalla la guerra anti-Norte de Corea, el territorio principal norteamericano podra sufrir una calamidad mas grande que en la Segunda Guerra Mundial" y "esa contienda podra causar un resultado catastrofico de 2 millones de muertos al maximo en EE.UU., el Sur de Corea y Japon".
					
					Los 58 generales retirados, inclusive el ex contralmirante   Michael Smith, enviaron publicamente el dia 13 de este mes un mensaje a Trump exigiendole cancelar inmediatamente el plan de la accion militar de EE.UU. y sus aliados apuntando que "ella podra causar el inmediato fuego de venganza del Norte de Corea sobre Seul que dejaria como saldo cientos de miles de muertos" y "se pondra en peligro la vida de 150 mil estadounidenses que viven en suelo surcoreano y EE.UU. se involucrara en la guerra que pudo prevenir".
					
					En su comentario insertado en la revista National Interest, el ex director del Estudio de la Politica de Defensa del Instituto Cato escribio que la guerra total con Corea producira consecuencias fatales.
					
					Recordo las palabras del ex comandante de las fuerzas norteamericanas en el Sur de Corea quien en 1994, cuando el entonces presidente Clinton examinaba el uso de fuerzas armadas contra el programa nuclear del Norte de Corea, habia confesado que la guerra con el Norte de Corea puede causar un millon de muertos como minimo y un billon de US$ de perdidas economicas.
					
					Un profesor estadounidense se pregunto que si fuera un presidente racional, podria hacer la guerra con el Norte de Corea conociendo que Pyongyang puede disparar el misil con ojiva nuclear antes de que sufra el ataque aereo de las fuerzas norteamericanas.
					
					Segun la encuesta realizada en conjunto por Washington Post y ABC, casi 70% de los encuestados se opuso al ataque sorpresivo de EE.UU y el 82% expreso seria preocupacion por la guerra de gran dimension que comenzaria por el ataque militar de su pais.
					
					News Week transmitio que ese resultado del sondeo ha evidenciado que dos tercios de la poblacion estadounidense estan en contra de la guerra con la RPDC.
					
					Detras de esa opinion publica, hay una especie de advertencia de que se debe cambiar con valentia la politica sobre Corea dejando el peligroso modo de pensar.
					
					El ataque preventivo no es el derecho monopolizado de EE.UU.
					
					EE.UU debe ver serenamente la realidad al darse cuenta de que no son vanas la capacidad y la voluntad de ataque nuclear de la RPDC contra los provocadores.

articles.title: Minju Joson critica la visita del mandatario surcoreano al pais vecino
articles.content:
Minju Joson critica la visita del mandatario surcoreano al pais vecino
Pyongyang, 18 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El gobernante surcoreano dijo que su proposito de visita al pais vecino, realizada del dia 13 al 16, estuvo en discutir los remedios para la "recuperacion de relaciones" y el "problema nuclear y la paz".
					Pero, lo que persiguio el en realidad fue salir del aislamiento en la arena internacional y mendigar la cooperacion en presionar a la RPDC.
					
					Asi revela el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual divulgado hoy y prosigue:
					
					Durante esa visita, los titeres surcoreanos suplicaron sin verguenza la "recuperacion de relaciones" y expusieron su intento de redoblar la presion anti-RPDC mediante la peticion de "suspension del suministro de petroleo".

					Esos lacayos coloniales de EE.UU., que no tienen criterio fijo ni constancia, se dejan llevar por su patron gringo. 
					
					Entonces, seria la perdida de tiempo conversar con ellos.
					
					En resumen, la reciente visita del gobernante surcoreano fue la humillante y de bajeza diplomatica.
